meanings.definition: A person who seeks to collect or acquire all items in a particular category or series.
meanings.sent1: The completists in the group were determined to gather every comic book in the series.
meanings.sent2: The completists at the convention were excited to find the last rare action figure they needed.
meanings.sent3: The completists joked that they would even collect every single bottle cap they came across.
meanings.sent4: She was a completist when it came to her stamp collection, ensuring she had every stamp ever issued.
meanings.sent5: The completists scoured the flea market to complete their set of vintage postcards.

meanings.definition: Those who are dedicated to finishing or achieving a comprehensive understanding of a subject or collection.
meanings.sent1: The completists in the study group were determined to understand every detail of the topic.
meanings.sent2: As completists, they spent hours poring over the historical documents to gain full knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The completists playfully challenged each other to see who could memorize the most facts in a day.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to learning made her a completist in mastering new languages quickly.
meanings.sent5: The completists were like detectives, piecing together clues to solve the mystery of the ancient artifact.
